Articles.Content:
Is it possible to share that rebuild so we can once again use TS and MFT together?

I agree, It would be very appreciated!

Thanks!
Oh, it's possible, but if he distributes it, he takes on the responsibility for supporting it .
5.2.3 is out with the TweakScale interaction dll. I've been rather busy, thus the delay.
Just me or has all the ORS/ORSX resources used by RoverDude's OKS pack vanished from MFT?

5.2.3 is out with the TweakScale interaction dll. I've been rather busy, thus the delay.

Word. Thank you!

Anyone know why the Radial engine body (from stock + Stock Part Revamp) and the smaller version (from Tavarius's Pizza and Aerospace) is listed as having fuel when this mod and the NEAR/FAR mod is active?
Answered your crosspost in the NEAR thread.

Answered your crosspost in the NEAR thread.

... Ok. If I don't want FAR/NEAR, how do I replicate this?
Ferram answered there, as did I: it's stock KSP. If you want them to have fuel, play KSP.

Hello all. I just tried downloading this mod from the OP, and I get a download-specific error in Windows advising me that "ModularFueltanks_v5.2.3.zip might have been moved or deleted." I saw in the download interaction that the file originates from "taniwha.org". Manually visiting that page results in a blank browser screen that reads, "It works!

This is the default web page for this server.

The web server software is running but no content has been added, yet."

I get the impression that either I'm doing something wrong, there's a problem with the download link in the OP, or something funky happened to the repository at the other end. Can someone please advise me how to proceed? Thanks.

edit: After posting the above, I saw a "retry" option and clicked it. After some "waiting" messages, I seem to have downloaded the file with no further problems known to me at this time. Is there any further info I can provide to make this into a useful report? Thanks.

Edited November 22, 2014 by MisterFister

MisterFister: I have no clue what happened, but I'm glad things sorted themselves out.

The "it works!" page is because I'm lazy (it's been that way most of the time I've had the domain (over 15 years now)). The page for the directory holding the zip is even less informative (very deliberately, though: anti-bot mechanism).

I noticed the KW Rocketry 5m parts were missing MFT so here it is.

@PART[KW5mtankL05]
{
	//!RESOURCE[LiquidFuel] {}
	//!RESOURCE[Oxidizer] {}
	//!RESOURCE[MonoPropellant] {}
	//!RESOURCE[XenonGas] {}
	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleFuelTanks
		volume = 7680
		type = Default
	}
}

@PART[KW5mtankL1_5]
{
	//!RESOURCE[LiquidFuel] {}
	//!RESOURCE[Oxidizer] {}
	//!RESOURCE[MonoPropellant] {}
	//!RESOURCE[XenonGas] {}
	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleFuelTanks
		volume = 23040
		type = Default
	}
}

@PART[KW5mtankL3_5]
{
	//!RESOURCE[LiquidFuel] {}
	//!RESOURCE[Oxidizer] {}
	//!RESOURCE[MonoPropellant] {}
	//!RESOURCE[XenonGas] {}
	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleFuelTanks
		volume = 53760
		type = Default
	}
}

@PART[KWFuelAdapter5x2]
{
	//!RESOURCE[LiquidFuel] {}
	//!RESOURCE[Oxidizer] {}
	//!RESOURCE[MonoPropellant] {}
	//!RESOURCE[XenonGas] {}
	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleFuelTanks
		volume = 7027.64
		type = Default
	}
}

@PART[KWFuelAdapter5x3]
{
	//!RESOURCE[LiquidFuel] {}
	//!RESOURCE[Oxidizer] {}
	//!RESOURCE[MonoPropellant] {}
	//!RESOURCE[XenonGas] {}
	MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleFuelTanks
		volume = 5296.398
		type = Default
	}
}

I noticed the KW Rocketry 5m parts were missing MFT so here it is.

*snip*

Not only the 5m tanks are missing. MFT is missing all the changes from KW version 2.6, which is

* 5m parts

* 0.5 length parts for all sizes

* balance tweaks on many tanks - MFT has the old values, negating KW's rebalance.

Edit:

* also missing the unpainted 2.5m / 3.75m tanks (that's why they have different stats than the painted ones.)

I am going through the KW_modularFuelTanks.cfg and correcting / adding values. I'll post it when I'm done.

Edited December 10, 2014 by MarvinCZ

Is it OK to post larger chunks of code inside the post or should it be elsewhere? It's OK license-wise.

Anyway, this is the KW_modularFuelTanks.cfg updated for KW Rocketry v2.6d2.

KW_modularFuelTanks.cfg

Edit: Converted to link.

Edited December 11, 2014 by MarvinCZ
You might want to just send that in as a pull request, I'm sure taniwha would love the help.

Good idea, I will do that.

Edit:

Done.

Edited December 11, 2014 by MarvinCZ
Is only me, but when i put Modular Fuel Tanks, it remove the TAC Life Support from my command pods stock, B9, Alcor, and from Crew parts from B9 too?
TACLS has its own MFT-aware patches. However, they may not be applied properly to vessels in flight.

The problem is that they might not be working on construction, where is my problem. Because the ones in flight, was already right, that time i was not using MFT yet.

Don't know what to do Nathan...

For now, i just remove MFT.

EDIT: find them Nathan on a new download...

EDIT2: Solved Nathan. Thank you man. Hugs to the Mod crew!

Edited December 11, 2014 by Climberfx
Any word on an MFT update? Gave it a whirl in 0.90 and it didn't seem to work - no crashy, but also no right click options in the VAB/SPH.
New MFT should be out soon. Mostly waiting on Tweakscale (need to check).
While TS has been updated, certain plugins that come with it are not initializing correctly. I'm currently researching whether or not they're even used anymore.

While TS has been updated, certain plugins that come with it are not initializing correctly. I'm currently researching whether or not they're even used anymore.

Yeah, I noticed such in my logs. I decided to release an updated MFT anyway as I can always do a patch release if necessary.
